CLUE: Part of a church sounds roguish
FOUND IN: Clerestory Windows - High windows in a church that allow light into the nave, which might seem "roguish" if their design is non-traditional.
Yin - Opposite force or principle to Yang, representing darker aspects like receptivity and femininity in Chinese philosophy.
Taper off - To gradually decrease in intensity or quantity towards the end.
Limerick - A humorous five-line poem, often anapestic trimeter, that typically follows the rhyme scheme AABBA and has a distinctive meter.
Helm - The part of the ship where the wheel or tiller is located, enabling the helmsman to control direction through a lever-like handle.
Ogden Nash - Ogden Hale Nash (a prominent American lyricist known for his light verse)
Bodega - A general term used globally to describe a winery or warehouse for storing wine; commonly found in Spanish-speaking regions, including Spain.
Leakage - Accidental escape of fluid or gas from its intended container or system.

CLUE: First letter of the Hebrew alphabet
FOUND IN: Aleph (◊ê) - The first letter of the Hebrew alphabet and also considered to symbolize beginnings or people's names in biblical contexts.
